definition: brightness from the sun or from a light, which allows you to see things
a particular type of brightness
brightness from the sun during the day
a piece of electrical equipment that produces brightness
one of the lights on a car or other vehicle
one of a set of traffic lights
something used for lighting a cigarette
to be a famous or successful performer
in: The room gets a lot of light in the afternoons.
light shines: Light from the street lamps was shining through a gap in the curtains.
a beam/flash/shaft/ray of light: The clouds parted and a single beam of light fell on the church.
by the light of something  (=using the light from something): The house could be clearly seen by the light of the moon.
be/stand in someone’s light  (=to prevent someone from seeing something by standing between them and a light): It’s harder when you keep standing in my light.
the grey light of dawn
The lamp produces a very warm soft light.
The light started to fade so we had to stop playing.
I could see a light in the window of the farmhouse.
turn on/switch on/put on a light: Could somebody put the light on?
turn off/switch off/put off a light: I turned the lights off and shut the door.
a light comes on: Lights were coming on in the street.
a light goes off/out: The light flickered and went out.
a warning/security light: A red warning light comes on when the brake fluid is low.
You’ve left your lights on.
I nearly drove through a red light.
the lights: Turn left at the lights.
Have you got a light?
bring something to light
catch the light
go out like a light
in a bad/new/different etc light
in (the) light of something
light at the end of the tunnel
(the) light dawns
a light in someone’s eyes
the light of someone’s life
the lights are on but no one’s home
punch/put someone’s lights out
see the light of day
set light to something
throw/shed/cast light on something

definition: the brightness that comes from the sun, fire, etc. and from electrical devices, and that allows things to be seen:
a piece of equipment that produces light, such as a lamp or a bulb:
traffic lights (= a set of red, yellow, and green lights that control the movement of vehicles, usually at a point where two or more roads join):
something that will produce a flame and cause burning, such as a match or a cigarette lighter:
to cause something to start burning:
animal lungs eaten as food:
not weighing a lot:
Light clothes are made of thin material that allows you to be cool:
lit by the natural light of the day:
(of colours) pale:
entertaining and easily understood, but not serious and not intended to make you think:
to behave as if a situation, especially a problem, is not serious or important:
not great in strength or amount:
someone who eats/drinks/smokes only a little
someone who is easily woken up by noise, etc.
A light meal is small and easy to digest:
used to describe alcoholic drinks that are not strong in flavour:
needing only a very small amount of effort:
A light sentence in prison is a short one:
to do something quickly and easily:
to start to burn or to make something start to burn:
to produce light that makes an object or area bright or easy to see:
the energy from the sun or fire and from electrical devices that allows you to see clearly:
A light is also anything that provides light, esp. an electric lamp:
A light is also a traffic light:
a device used to produce a flame, such as a match:
having little weight; not heavy:
Clothes that are light are made of thin material which allows you to be cool:
A light meal is a small one:
(of food) having less fat or fewer calories than usual:
intended to entertain; not serious:
not great in strength or amount; slight:
A light sentence in prison is a short one.
Tastes and smells described as light are not obvious:
A light eater/drinker eats or drinks only a little.
providing energy from the sun that allows you to see clearly:
(of colors) pale:
to provide with energy from the sun, fire, or electrical devices that allow you to see clearly:
to produce a flame:
not great in size, strength, or amount:
used for describing forms of transport that are smaller or that use less power than the usual kind:
needing only a very small amount of work or effort:
not having a lot of something:
to do something quickly or easily:
a way of thinking about or understanding something:
to show something about a situation that was previously unknown:
to give someone permission to do something:
because of something or as a result of something:

Light can be used to describe many things, like a person's personality, overall goodness, or as a state of mind. Light is what exists, what will exist and what always has existed, and nothing can change that no mater how hard someone tries. People can try to remove the light from their being, but none can trully do it. No matter how dark a person's outwardly appearence, the light will always be there deep within that persons very soul. Shrouded be darkness, it will still shine bright, waiting for it's time to rise again. For the truth is that darkness cannot exist without light. They are like two sides of a coin, coexisting with one another. Sure one side may overpower the other at times, but that side cannot be completely consumed. So can be said for the human heart... no matter how much a person grieves and hurts, and no matter how empty that persons life feels, the light will still remain, deep within that persons heart as hope, and will wait in patience until it is called uppon to return to the surface.

An incredibly talented singer/songwriter from Timmins, Ontario. LIGHTS Poxleitner was recognized for rad her synth- pop skills with a Juno award for the song Drive My Soul. Also known for her artistic abilities (especially drawing comics), LIGHTS does all of the artwork for her albums.Sometimes referred to as the female equivalent of Owl City, this talented young woman's success was launched on MySpace. Common hobbies include: playing WoW, hanging out with her tarantula Lance, making vlogs, and being made of awesome.

1) the form of electromagnetic radiation that acts upon the retina of the eye, optic nerve, etc., making sight possible
2) brightness; illumination, often of a specified kind
3) the light from the sun; daylight or dawn
4) mental illumination; knowledge or information; enlightenment
5) a person whose brilliant record makes him or her an example for others and yourself. A person who brings light into your life
easy; short for "light-work"
